p: L.acaciae was thought to compact diabetes through its flavonoids, which are suggested to demonstrate powerful antioxidant activity, and act as inhibitors of biological targets, mostly enzymes such as α-glycosidase, α-amylase, and dipeptidyl peptidase IV (DPP-4). These results further support the claim for and use of L. acaciae in folklore medicine in Saudi Arabia as an antidiabetic drug [ 38].
